revised_title: On the Mechanical Equivalent of Heat: A New Approach to Determining the Heat in Mechanical Units
tldr: This article presents a new method for determining the mechanical equivalent of heat using a hydraulic brake dynamometer. The research focuses on measuring the work expended in raising the temperature of ice-cold water to boiling point and comparing it to the heat produced. The author discusses the challenges and limitations of previous methods and introduces a new approach using specialized equipment and techniques.
